title: Sagrada Familia book cover SERIF FONT ID
content:
can anybody identify this pretty serif font? thanks,  
danny

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20090430170400im_/http:/typophile.com/files/22_temple_5368.jpg)

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20090430170400im_/http:/typophile.com/files/22_cano_5653.jpg)
author: SKUMATIK

comments.content:
We had that one so many times before.  
That’s ITC Didi – no digital version available.
no digital version! crap, how did he use it then? scanned from a book?
There was a digital version once (from Image Club), but there isn’t any more.
damn you image club! thanks jan for your help

As far as I know it’s rather Adobe’s fault.

You’re welcome.

...or ITC’s fault for never digitizing it. Alternatives: [Modern Display](http://web.archive.org/web/20090430170400/http:/www.fontshop.com/fontcase/subclasses/serif_bracketed_modern_display/) and [Didona](http://web.archive.org/web/20090430170400/http:/www.fontshop.com/fonts/singles/paratype/didona_book_ot/).
